    Upgrading Fission

    If you’re using Helm

    If you installed Fission using helm, upgrade is as simple as helm upgrade:

    # Find the name of the release you want to upgrade
$ helm list

# Upgrade it 
$ helm upgrade <release_name> https://github.com/fission/fission/releases/download/latest/fission-all-latest.tgz

    Replace fission-all with fission-core if you’re using the minimal Fission install.

    If you’re not using Helm

    If you installed using kubectl apply of a YAML file, you can simply kubectl apply the new file.

    
$ kubectl apply -f https://github.com/fission/fission/releases/download/latest/fission-all-latest.yaml

    Replace fission-all with fission-core if you’re using the minimal install.

    Use the -minikube suffix if you’re on minikube, as follows:

    
$ kubectl apply -f https://github.com/fission/fission/releases/download/latest/fission-all-latest-minikube.yaml

    Upgrading older versions

    Please see older documentation versions to upgrade version prior to 0.4.x:

    https://docs.fission.io/latest/installation/upgrade/

    Improve this page

    Fission is a project by Platform9 Systems and many contributors. Reach us on Slack or Twitter.
